review: I purchased this Amazon Fire TV from a local retailer. At the time of purchase, the retailer told me that many of the sales since its release date were being returned, but i wanted to try it anyway. I subscribe to Amazon Prime Instant Video, which is a great service when they actually keep adding new content but not taking even more away as they add it. I have a ROKU 3 player but i thought i would upgrade because of the reports of this Fire TV box being faster and having  better picture. It is a wee bit faster..but is seriously not noticeable compared to the ROKU 3 and my 40MB Fiber broadband internet connection. The apps do include the basic most popular ones including Netflix, Hulu Plus, Crackle, Vevo, Youtube and of course their own Amazon content. It does not have VUDU, a Wal-Mart company that most people have chosen for their digital HD copies. Flixster has the copies also but the picture is not clear HD and poor quality. One app called Classic TV is a serious joke with barely a dozen tv shows with only 2 being actual popular classic tv. No HBO Go and no religious channels at all to choose from like TBN. The ROKU 3 can keep up with this device and has thousands of channels to choose from. Returning this back to the store today.

review: First let me start off by saying that I love this device.I have a Google Chrome, Roku's, Kindle and Blue Ray to stream through but the Amazon Fire TV stream really fast. I love the feature that you can say what your looking for and it finds it. The games are really fun on the big screen that my grandson won't move from in front of the TV. LOL...... Now that's the good and now for the bad.The updates when you first turn it on is really slow and the company said in it's launch video that when you buy this device that it will be loaded with all your apps. But I find that to not be the case. I had to go through and re-download the apps that I had. The remote is very sensitive when it fell on the floor it turn on the device. I'm a little upset that it does not have HBO-To-Go app on there so I have to stream through the other devices I have which kind of suck. But all and all I still love it!!!!!!!
